scenarioDescription:
The HR 5183 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HR 5183 is a star with 1.07 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.53 times its radius. It is located 102.61 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 7.7 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HR 5183 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HR 5183 system


HR 5183 b

HR 5183 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2019-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 18.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HR 5183 b is 1027.140 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HR 5183 b is 13.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HR 5183 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HR 5183, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: HR 5183 - System With 1 Exoplanet
